Planning with connections in mind A lot of people stress about changing trains. But don't worry. Swiss stations are built for efficiency and the entire system is designed to make connections as smooth as possible. Here are a few tips to keep in mind: Minimum connection time is usually around 5-7 minutes, which is plenty for most Swiss stations thanks to short walking distances and punctual arrivals If you're travelling with lots of luggage, young kids or simply want to reduce stress, aim for 10-15 minutes When checking your timetable, note the platform numbers . The app or website will often show you both the departure and arrival platforms, so you can assess how far you might need to walk Follow the signs and digital boards.
